intro: Hemigraphis fruticulosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or red-veined sorrel, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a low-growing, evergreen shrub that typically reaches heights of 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy leaves with striking red veins, which give it its common name. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Hemigraphis fruticulosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and ease of care.
